name: plier
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who sells something or works regularly at something, especially at a job that involves selling things: Artists began to see themselves as more like vagabonds and social outcasts than humble pliers of a trade. I wanted to be more than just a plier of cheap goods. Related word

More examplesFewer examplesThere was no reason a woman could not be a plier of a trade.He demanded that the government make a national commitment to the expansion of a sustainable and responsible agricultural industry, rather than it being just a plier of cheap food.
